name: Ch.13ABaseConvo3
_source: speak;Gerik;Putting in the extra hours, I see.|That's the mark of a dedicated soldier.
speak;Franz;Gerik!|I didn't realize anyone was watching.|I was just finishing up my evening training.
speak;Gerik;Don't mind me.|But I couldn't help noticing your form with that sword.|It's a bit large for you, isn't it?
speak;Franz;Ah, well...|I thought training with a heavier blade might help me build strength.|My brother Forde says I need to work on my power strikes.
speak;Gerik;Not a bad idea in theory.|But your stance is all wrong for a sword that size.|You're fighting against the weapon instead of letting it work with you.
speak;Franz;Fighting against it?|I'm not sure I understand.
speak;Gerik;Here, let me show you.|May I?
speak;Gerik;See, with a heavier blade, you need to widen your stance.|Plant your feet more firmly.|Like this.
speak;Franz;Oh, I see.|So I should position my feet further apart?
speak;Gerik;Exactly.|And don't try to control the blade's full swing with just your wrists.|Use your shoulders and back to guide the momentum.|The weight of the sword should do most of the work.
speak;Franz;That makes sense.|I've been trying to handle it like my regular sword.|No wonder my arms are so sore.
speak;Gerik;A common mistake.|Try it now.|Feel the difference?
speak;Franz;Yes!|It's much easier to control this way.|The blade feels more balanced.
speak;Gerik;Good.|If you're serious about building up your frame, though, sword training alone won't cut it.
speak;Franz;What would you recommend?|I've noticed your...uh...build is quite impressive.
speak;Gerik;Ha!|No need to be shy about it.|This comes from years of training, not just swinging a sword.

speak;Gerik;For starters, find some heavy stones you can lift.|Do it every day, gradually increasing the weight.|Then there's tree climbing using just your arms.|And carrying a comrade in full armor up a hill never hurts.
speak;Franz;That sounds intense!|Do you still do all that training?
speak;Gerik;Every chance I get.|Though these days, battles keep me fit enough.|But when I was your age, I was doing this daily.
speak;Franz;I'll have to incorporate some of these into my routine.|Maybe not carrying someone in armor just yet, though.
speak;Gerik;Start small.|Even just doing push-ups with a rock on your back will make a difference.|The key is consistency.|Train every day, even if it's just a little.
speak;Franz;I can do that.|I'm usually up before dawn anyway.
speak;Gerik;That's the spirit.|And one more thing about that sword.
speak;Gerik;Try wrapping the grip with leather strips.|It'll give you better control and prevent blisters.|Your hands aren't calloused enough yet for extended training with a heavy blade.
speak;Franz;I'll do that!|Thank you for the advice, Gerik.|I really appreciate it.
speak;Gerik;Don't mention it.|We're all comrades here.|I like seeing young knights with dedication.
speak;Franz;Would you...maybe want to spar sometime?|I could learn a lot from someone with your experience.
speak;Gerik;Sure, why not?|Just don't expect me to go easy on you.|Even in practice, I fight to win.
speak;Franz;I wouldn't want it any other way!|I'll never improve if people hold back.
speak;Gerik;That's a good attitude.|Meet me here tomorrow at dawn.|We'll see what you're made of.
speak;Franz;I'll be here!|And I'll be ready!
speak;Franz;Wider stance...|Use my shoulders...|Let the momentum work for me...|I should practice this a bit more before tomorrow.
